snippet: In a New Year’s speech, Kim Jong-un, North Korea’s leader, proclaimed he was open to a “big shift” toward improved relations with South Korea.
abstract: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un addresses nation in New Year's speech, saying he is looking to improve relations with South Korea and is willing to sit down with Pres Park Geun-hye; analysts question whether Kim's overture is genuine.
lead_paragraph: In a New Year’s speech, Kim Jong-un, North Korea’s leader, proclaimed he was open to a “big shift” toward improved relations with South Korea.

headline.main: North Korean Leader Says He’s Open to Summit With South
headline.print_headline: North Korean Leader Seeks Meeting With South’s President
